alert.note: Alert for Cuyahoga; Lake (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 23 at 8:43PM EDT until August 24 at 1:45AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cleveland has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Cuyahoga County in northeastern Ohio... Southwestern Lake County in northeastern Ohio... * Until 145 AM EDT. * At 843 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and reports of considerable flooding. Water rescues are underway in some portions of Willoughby and Willowick IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cleveland, Painesville, Willowick, Euclid, Mentor, Cleveland Heights, Willoughby, Eastlake, Timberlake, Lakeline, South Euclid, Mayfield Heights, East Cleveland, Lyndhurst, Wickliffe, Richmond Heights, Willoughby Hills, Highland Heights, Mentor-On-The-Lake and Kirtland. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
